I leapt from the window and joined the throng of people rushing to escape the inferno, while Holmes, still seated on the couch, watched the chaos with an air of detached interest. The maid, who had thrown open the window, was now frantically trying to rouse the occupants of the house, but they seemed to be in a state of shock, unable to comprehend the gravity of the situation. The flames were now licking at the curtains, and the smoke was growing thicker by the second, making it difficult to see or breathe. I grabbed a nearby bucket of water and flung it at the fire, but it only seemed to spread the flames further, and I realized that we needed to act quickly if we were to save anyone from the burning building. I turned to Holmes, who was still sitting calmly on the couch, and shouted at him to do something, but he simply shook his head and continued to observe the scene with an air of fascination. I was starting to get desperate, and I knew that we had to think fast if we were to get out of this situation alive. The flames were now engulfing the room, and the heat was becoming unbearable. I spotted a small child, no more than five years old, cowering in the corner of the room, and I knew that I had to act fast to save it. I rushed over to the child and scooped it up in my arms, shielding it from the heat and the smoke. I turned to Holmes, who was still sitting on the couch, and shouted at him to help me, but he just shook his head and continued to watch the fire with an air of detachment. I was starting to lose hope, and I knew that we were running out of time. The flames were now licking at the door, and I knew that we had to get out of there, and fast. I turned to the child in my arms and shouted at it to hold on tight, and then I made a dash for the window, the flames and smoke closing in behind us. We tumbled out onto the street, gasping for air, and I looked back to see the house engulfed in flames, the windows shattering and the roof collapsing. I turned to Holmes, who was still sitting on the couch, and shouted at him to get up, but he just shook his head and continued to watch the fire with an air of fascination. I was furious, and I knew that I had to get him out of there, and fast. I grabbed him by the arm and pulled him to his feet, and we stumbled out into the street, the child still clutched in my arms. We were all three of us coughing and choking, but we were alive, and that was all that mattered. As we stumbled away from the burning building, I turned to Holmes and demanded to know what he had been thinking, sitting there like that while the house was burning down around us. He just smiled and said that he had been observing the behavior of the flames, and that he had learned something important. I was too angry to listen, and I just shook my head and walked away, leaving him to his strange and inexplicable behavior. But as I looked back at the burning building, I couldn't help but wonder what he had learned, and what it might mean for our investigation.

en_first_half: “The man married a woman very much older than himself for her money,” said he, “and he enjoyed the use of the money of the daughter as long as she lived with them. It was a considerable sum, for people in their position, and the loss of it would have made a serious difference. It was worth an effort to preserve it. The daughter was of a good, amiable disposition, but affectionate and warm-hearted in her ways, so that it was evident that with her fair personal advantages, and her little income, she would not be allowed to remain single long. Now her marriage would mean, of course, the loss of a hundred a year, so what does her stepfather do to prevent it? He takes the obvious course
en_second_half: of keeping her at home and forbidding her to seek the company of people of her own age. But soon he found that that would not answer forever. She became restive, insisted upon her rights, and finally announced her positive intention of going to a certain ball. What does her clever stepfather do then? He conceives an idea more creditable to his head than to his heart. With the connivance and assistance of his wife he disguised himself, covered those keen eyes with tinted glasses, masked the face with a moustache and a pair of bushy whiskers, sunk that clear voice into an insinuating whisper, and doubly secure on account of the girl’s short sight, he appears as Mr. Hosmer Angel, and keeps off other lovers by making love himself.”

Đó là một món hời đáng kể đối với những người trong cuộc và việc mất đi số tiền đó sẽ là một sự thay đổi rất đáng sợ. Cần phải ra sức duy trì tình trạng đó. Cô con gái không những rất tốt bụng và tử tế mà còn giàu tình cảm và hay biểu lộ ra, vì thế dễ nhận thấy là với sự nết na cộng thêm món thu nhập nho nhỏ thì cô ta sẽ không ở vậy lâu. Tất nhiên, nếu cô ta kết hôn thì họ sẽ mất đi hàng trăm bảng mỗi năm, vậy người cha dượng phải làm gì để ngăn chặn điều đó? Ông ta chọn cách dễ thấy là giữ cô ta ở trong nhà và ngăn cấm cô ta tìm
vi_second_half: kiếm bạn bè cùng lứa tuổi. Nhưng rồi ông ta nhanh chóng nhận ra đó không phải là giải pháp lâu dài. en_results_raw: inches deep, so it was clear that he must have fallen in of his own accord. The only clue to the mystery was a small piece of paper clutched in his hand, which, when we managed to pry it loose, was found to contain a cryptic message scrawled in his own handwriting: 'The truth is in the garden, but beware the eyes that watch.' We were at a loss to decipher its meaning, and it was not until several days later, when the local constabulary arrived to investigate, that we began to piece together the events of that fateful night. It transpired that our friend had been acting strangely in the days leading up to his disappearance, and several of the villagers reported seeing him arguing with a mysterious figure in the dead of night. The figure was described as tall and gaunt, with eyes that seemed to bore into the very soul. We could not help but wonder if this was the 'eyes' referred to in the cryptic message, and if our friend had stumbled upon some dark secret that he was not meant to uncover. As the investigation continued, we began to uncover a web of deceit and corruption that went far beyond a simple case of a man gone missing. It seemed that our friend had been poking his nose into places it did not belong, and the consequences were dire. The more we learned, the more we realized that the truth was far more sinister than we could have ever imagined, and that the 'garden' referred to in the message was not just a literal place, but a metaphor for the dark underbelly of our seemingly idyllic community.

en_first_half: “Away we went then, and we drove for at least an hour. Colonel Lysander Stark had said that it was only seven miles, but I should think, from the rate that we seemed to go, and from the time that we took, that it must have been nearer twelve. He sat at my side in silence all the time, and I was aware, more than once when I glanced in his direction, that he was looking at me with great intensity. The country roads seem to be not very good in that part of the world, for we lurched and jolted terribly. I tried to look out of the windows to see something of where we were, but they were made of frosted glass, and I could make out nothing save the occasional bright blur
en_second_half: of a passing light. Now and then I hazarded some remark to break the monotony of the journey, but the colonel answered only in monosyllables, and the conversation soon flagged. At last, however, the bumping of the road was exchanged for the crisp smoothness of a gravel-drive, and the carriage came to a stand. Colonel Lysander Stark sprang out, and, as I followed after him, pulled me swiftly into a porch which gaped in front of us. We stepped, as it were, right out of the carriage and into the hall, so that I failed to catch the most fleeting glance of the front of the house. The instant that I had crossed the threshold the door slammed heavily behind us, and I heard faintly the rattle of the wheels as the carriage drove away.

es_first_half: "Nos fuimos entonces, y condujimos durante al menos una hora. El coronel Lysander Stark había dicho que sólo eran siete millas, pero yo creía, por la velocidad a la que parecíamos ir, y por el tiempo que tardamos, que debían ser más de doce. Se sentó a mi lado en silencio todo el tiempo, y me di cuenta, más de una vez cuando miré en su dirección, que me estaba mirando con gran intensidad. Parece que las carreteras rurales no son muy buenas en esa parte del mundo, porque dimos unos bandazos y sacudidas terribles. Intenté mirar por las ventanillas para ver algo de dónde estábamos, pero eran de vidrio esmerilado, y no pude distinguir nada más que el borrón ocasional de una luz que pasaba. De vez en
es_second_half: cuando me arriesgaba a hacer algún comentario para romper la monotonía del viaje, pero el coronel sólo respondía con monosílabos, y la conversación pronto decaía. Por fin, sin embargo, los golpes de la carretera fueron sustituidos por la crujiente suavidad de un camino de grava, y el carruaje se detuvo. El coronel Lysander Stark se bajó de él y, mientras yo lo seguía, me arrastró a un porche que se abría ante nosotros. Bajamos, por así decirlo, del carruaje y entramos en el vestíbulo, de modo que no pude echar la más fugaz mirada a la fachada de la casa. En el instante en que crucé el umbral, la puerta se cerró de golpe detrás de nosotros, y oí débilmente el traqueteo de las ruedas mientras el carruaje se alejaba."

en_first_half: “It was pitch dark inside the house, and the colonel fumbled about looking for matches and muttering under his breath. Suddenly a door opened at the other end of the passage, and a long, golden bar of light shot out in our direction. It grew broader, and a woman appeared with a lamp in her hand, which she held above her head, pushing her face forward and peering at us. I could see that she was pretty, and from the gloss with which the light shone
en_second_half: upon her dark dress I knew that it was a rich material. She spoke a few words in a foreign tongue in a tone as though asking a question, and when my companion answered in a gruff monosyllable she gave such a start that the lamp nearly fell from her hand. Colonel Stark went up to her, whispered something in her ear, and then, pushing her back into the room from whence she had come, he walked towards me again with the lamp in his hand.
en_results: on her hair, I took her to be a woman of some refinement, but her eyes, which were fixed intently on the colonel, seemed to hold a mixture of fear and suspicion. She took a step forward, and the light from the lamp cast eerie shadows on the walls, making it seem as though the very darkness itself was moving. The colonel, still muttering to himself, stumbled towards her, his eyes fixed on the lamp, and I could see the faint glint of a
en_results_raw: on her hair, I took her to be a woman of some refinement, but her eyes, which were fixed intently on the colonel, seemed to hold a mixture of fear and suspicion. She took a step forward, and the light from the lamp cast eerie shadows on the walls, making it seem as though the very darkness itself was moving. The colonel, still muttering to himself, stumbled towards her, his eyes fixed on the lamp, and I could see the faint glint of a pistol in his hand. The woman's gaze flickered to the pistol, and for a moment, I thought I saw a flash of alarm cross her face, but it was quickly replaced by a look of calm determination. She took another step forward, her eyes never leaving the colonel's face, and I could sense a strange tension building in the air. The silence was oppressive, and I found myself holding my breath, wondering what would happen next. The woman's voice, when it came, was low and steady, and it sent a shiver down my spine as she spoke a single word: "Colonel." The colonel's muttering ceased, and he turned to face her, his eyes narrowing slightly as he regarded her. I could see the faintest glimmer of recognition in his eyes, and for a moment, I thought he might say something, but instead, he simply stood there, frozen, as the woman's gaze held him in a silent command. The air was thick with unspoken words, and I felt as though I was witnessing a scene from a different era, one where the rules of polite society no longer applied. The woman's hand, still holding the lamp, was steady, but I could sense a subtle tremble in her fingers, and I wondered what secrets lay hidden behind her calm exterior. The colonel, still frozen, seemed to be waiting for something, but I had no idea what. And then, without warning, the woman spoke again, her voice a little louder this time, and it sent a jolt through the air: "What are you doing here, Colonel?" The colonel's eyes snapped back into focus, and he took a step forward, his hand still clutching the pistol, and I felt a surge of fear as I realized that this was no ordinary encounter.

Quầng sáng lớn dần lên và một người phụ nữ xuất hiện, giơ một ngọn đèn cao quá đầu. Bà ta ngấng mặt lên và chăm chú nhìn chúng tôi. Tôi có thể thấy rõ là bà ta khá đẹp và qua vẻ bóng mượt của bộ y phục sẫm

es_first_half: "Estaba muy oscuro dentro de la casa, y el coronel buscaba a tientas cerillas y murmuraba en voz baja. De repente se abrió una puerta en el otro extremo del pasillo y una larga barra de luz dorada salió disparada en nuestra dirección. Se ensanchó y apareció una mujer con una lámpara en la mano, que sostenía por encima de la cabeza, adelantando la cara y mirándonos. Pude ver que era guapa, y por el brillo con que la luz iluminaba
es_second_half: su vestido oscuro supe que era de un material rico. Pronunció algunas palabras en una lengua extranjera, en un tono como si estuviera haciendo una pregunta, y cuando mi compañero respondió con un monosílabo ronco, se sobresaltó tanto que la lámpara casi se le cayó de la mano. El coronel Stark se acercó a ella, le susurró algo al oído y luego, empujándola hacia la habitación de la que había salido, volvió a caminar hacia mí con la lámpara en la mano."

es_results_raw: su rostro, su cabello y sus ojos, que brillaban como dos estrellas en la noche, me pareció que era una mujer de una belleza sobrenatural. La luz de la lámpara parecía bailar en sus mejillas y en sus labios, que se curvaban en una sonrisa que me hizo sentir un escalofrío en la espalda. El coronel se levantó de su asiento y se acercó a ella, con una expresión de sorpresa y admiración en su rostro. La mujer se acercó a nosotros, y su sonrisa se hizo más amplia, revelando una dentadura perfecta y blancos dientes. Me sentí atraído por ella, como si estuviera bajo el hechizo de una magia antigua. El coronel se inclinó hacia ella y le habló en voz baja, y ella respondió con una risa musical que me hizo sentir que estaba en un sueño. Me pareció que la habitación se había vuelto más pequeña y más oscura, y que la luz de la lámpara era la única realidad que existía en ese momento. La mujer se acercó más a nosotros, y su aliento fresco me rozó la cara, haciendo que me sintiera vivo y alerta. El coronel se apartó de ella y se dirigió hacia la puerta, diciendo algo en voz baja, y la mujer se volvió hacia mí, con una mirada que me hizo sentir que estaba viendo en su interior. Me pareció que estaba a punto de decir algo, pero se detuvo y se volvió hacia la puerta, siguiendo al coronel. Me quedé solo en la habitación, con la luz de la lámpara brillando en mi rostro, y me sentí perdido y confundido. ¿Quién era esa mujer, y qué quería? ¿Qué había pasado en esa habitación, y qué secreto estaba escondido detrás de la sonrisa de la mujer? Me quedé allí, con la luz de la lámpara brillando en mi rostro, intentando encontrar respuestas a mis preguntas, pero solo encontré más misterio y más oscuridad.

es_results_raw: al jardín, donde me mostró un gran número de plantas exóticas y me explicó que había estado cultivando durante años. Me pareció que estaba muy orgulloso de su trabajo, pero también noté que parecía estar nervioso y alterado, como si estuviera esperando algo. Me pregunté qué podría ser, pero no se me ocurrió nada en ese momento. Al día siguiente, mientras estaba en la cocina, escuché una conversación entre el señor y la señora Rucastle que me pareció extraña. Estaban hablando en voz baja, pero pude escuchar que decían algo sobre una "cosa" que debía ser entregada a alguien, y que era muy importante que no se supiera nada. Me pregunté qué podría ser, pero no se me ocurrió nada en ese momento. Luego, mientras estaba en mi habitación, escuché un ruido extraño proveniente del jardín, como si alguien estuviera moviéndose furtivamente. Me asomé a la ventana y vi a una figura oscura que se alejaba rápidamente. Me pareció que era una mujer, pero no pude ver su rostro. Me pregunté quién podría ser y qué estaba haciendo allí. Al día siguiente, mientras estaba en la biblioteca, encontré un libro antiguo que parecía haber sido leído con frecuencia. Era un libro de historia, y había una página marcada con un trozo de papel. La página hablaba sobre un asesinato que había ocurrido en la casa hace muchos años, y me pareció que había una conexión entre eso y los incidentes que había estado experimentando. Me pregunté si podría estar relacionado con la "cosa" que el señor y la señora Rucastle habían estado hablando sobre. Me sentí intrigado y decidí investigar más a fondo.
